intro: Sloanea illinizae, commonly known as the Illinizas sloanea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and paramo ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
